name: 希伯来书
description: 写给希伯来基督徒的书信，论述基督的超越性和新约的优越性

verses.zh: 神既在古时藉着众先知多次多方的晓谕列祖，
verses.en: In the past God spoke to our ancestors through the prophets at many times and in various ways,

verses.zh: 就在这末世藉着他儿子晓谕我们；又早已立他为承受万有的，也曾藉着他创造诸世界。
verses.en: but in these last days he has spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, and through whom also he made the universe.

verses.zh: 他是神荣耀所发的光辉，是神本体的真像，常用他权能的命令托住万有。他洗净了人的罪，就坐在高天至大者的右边。
verses.en: The Son is the radiance of God's glory and the exact representation of his being, sustaining all things by his powerful word. After he had provided purification for sins, he sat down at the right hand of the Majesty in heaven.

verses.zh: 他既比天使更美，所得的名，也比天使的名更尊贵。
verses.en: So he became as much superior to the angels as the name he has inherited is superior to theirs.

verses.zh: 所有的天使，神从来对哪一个说：'你是我的儿子，我今日生你'？又指着哪一个说：'我要作他的父，他要作我的子'？
verses.en: For to which of the angels did God ever say, 'You are my Son; today I have become your Father'? Or again, 'I will be his Father, and he will be my Son'?

verses.zh: 再者，神使长子到世上来的时候（或译：神再使长子到世上来的时候），就说：'神的使者都要拜他。'
verses.en: And again, when God brings his firstborn into the world, he says, 'Let all God's angels worship him.'

verses.zh: 论到使者，又说：'神以风为使者，以火焰为仆役'；
verses.en: In speaking of the angels he says, 'He makes his angels spirits, and his servants flames of fire.'

verses.zh: 论到子却说：'神啊，你的宝座是永永远远的；你的国权是正直的。
verses.en: But about the Son he says, 'Your throne, O God, will last for ever and ever; a scepter of justice will be the scepter of your kingdom.

verses.zh: 你喜爱公义，恨恶罪恶；所以神，就是你的神，用喜乐油膏你，胜过膏你的同伴'；
verses.en: You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness; therefore God, your God, has set you above your companions by anointing you with the oil of joy.'

verses.zh: 又说：'主啊，你起初立了地的根基；天也是你手所造的。
verses.en: He also says, 'In the beginning, Lord, you laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of your hands.

verses.zh: 天地都要灭没，你却要长存。天地都要像衣服渐渐旧了；
verses.en: They will perish, but you remain; they will all wear out like a garment.

verses.zh: 你要将天地卷起来，像一件外衣，天地就都改变了。惟有你永不改变；你的年数没有穷尽。'
verses.en: You will roll them up like a robe; like a garment they will be changed. But you remain the same, and your years will never end.'

verses.zh: 所有的天使，神从来对哪一个说：'你坐在我的右边，等我使你仇敌作你的脚凳'？
verses.en: To which of the angels did God ever say, 'Sit at my right hand until I make your enemies a footstool for your feet'?

verses.zh: 天使岂不都是服役的灵、奉差遣为那将要承受救恩的人效力吗？
verses.en: Are not all angels ministering spirits sent to serve those who will inherit salvation?

verses.zh: 所以，我们当越发郑重所听见的道理，恐怕我们随流失去。
verses.en: We must pay the most careful attention, therefore, to what we have heard, so that we do not drift away.

verses.zh: 那藉着天使所传的话既是确定的；凡干犯悖逆的都受了该受的报应。
verses.en: For since the message spoken through angels was binding, and every violation and disobedience received its just punishment,

verses.zh: 我们若忽略这么大的救恩，怎能逃罪呢？这救恩起先是主亲自讲的，后来是听见的人给我们证实了。
verses.en: how shall we escape if we ignore so great a salvation? This salvation, which was first announced by the Lord, was confirmed to us by those who heard him.

verses.zh: 神又按自己的旨意，用神迹、奇事和百般的异能，并圣灵的恩赐，同他们作见证。
verses.en: God also testified to it by signs, wonders and various miracles, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed according to his will.

verses.zh: 我们所说将来的世界，神原没有交给天使管辖。
verses.en: It is not to angels that he has subjected the world to come, about which we are speaking.

verses.zh: 但有人在经上某处证明说：'人算什么，你竟顾念他？世人算什么，你竟眷顾他？
verses.en: But there is a place where someone has testified: 'What is mankind that you are mindful of them, a son of man that you care for him?

verses.zh: 你叫他比天使微小一点（或译：你叫他暂时比天使小），赐他荣耀尊贵为冠冕，并将你手所造的都派他管理，
verses.en: You made them a little lower than the angels; you crowned them with glory and honor

verses.zh: 叫万物都服在他的脚下。'既叫万物都服他，就没有剩下一样不服他的。只是如今我们还不见万物都服他。
verses.en: and put everything under their feet.' In putting everything under them, God left nothing that is not subject to them. Yet at present we do not see everything subject to them.

verses.zh: 惟独见那成为比天使小一点的耶稣（或译：惟独见耶稣暂时比天使小）；因为受死的苦，就得了尊贵荣耀为冠冕，叫他因着神的恩，为人人尝了死味。
verses.en: But we do see Jesus, who was made lower than the angels for a little while, now crowned with glory and honor because he suffered death, so that by the grace of God he might taste death for everyone.

verses.zh: 原来那为万物所属、为万物所本的，要领许多的儿子进荣耀里去，使救他们的元帅，因受苦难得以完全，本是合宜的。
verses.en: In bringing many sons and daughters to glory, it was fitting that God, for whom and through whom everything exists, should make the pioneer of their salvation perfect through what he suffered.

verses.zh: 因那使人成圣的和那些得以成圣的，都是出于一。所以，他称他们为弟兄也不以为耻，
verses.en: Both the one who makes people holy and those who are made holy are of the same family. So Jesus is not ashamed to call them brothers and sisters.

verses.zh: 说：'我要将你的名传与我的弟兄，在会中我要颂扬你'；
verses.en: He says, 'I will declare your name to my brothers and sisters; in the assembly I will sing your praises.'

verses.zh: 又说：'我要倚赖他'；又说：'看哪，我与神所给我的儿女。'
verses.en: And again, 'I will put my trust in him.' And again he says, 'Here am I, and the children God has given me.'

verses.zh: 儿女既同有血肉之体，他也照样亲自成了血肉之体，特要藉着死败坏那掌死权的，就是魔鬼，
verses.en: Since the children have flesh and blood, he too shared in their humanity so that by his death he might break the power of him who holds the power of death—that is, the devil—

verses.zh: 并要释放那些一生因怕死而为奴仆的人。
verses.en: and free those who all their lives were held in slavery by their fear of death.

verses.zh: 他并不救拔天使，乃是救拔亚伯拉罕的后裔。
verses.en: For surely it is not angels he helps, but Abraham's descendants.

verses.zh: 所以，他凡事该与他的弟兄相同，为要在神的事上成为慈悲忠信的大祭司，为百姓的罪献上挽回祭。
verses.en: For this reason he had to be made like them, fully human in every way, in order that he might become a merciful and faithful high priest in service to God, and that he might make atonement for the sins of the people.

verses.zh: 他自己既然被试探而受苦，就能搭救被试探的人。
verses.en: Because he himself suffered when he was tempted, he is able to help those who are being tempted.

verses.zh: 同蒙天召的圣洁弟兄啊，你们应当思想我们所认为使者、为大祭司的耶稣。
verses.en: Therefore, holy brothers and sisters, who share in the heavenly calling, fix your thoughts on Jesus, whom we acknowledge as our apostle and high priest.

verses.zh: 他为那设立他的尽忠，如同摩西在神的全家尽忠一样。
verses.en: He was faithful to the one who appointed him, just as Moses was faithful in all God's house.

verses.zh: 他比摩西算是更配多得荣耀，好像建造房屋的比房屋更尊荣；
verses.en: Jesus has been found worthy of greater honor than Moses, just as the builder of a house has greater honor than the house itself.

verses.zh: 因为房屋都必有人建造，但建造万物的就是神。
verses.en: For every house is built by someone, but God is the builder of everything.

verses.zh: 摩西为仆人，在神的全家诚然尽忠，为要证明将来必传说的事。
verses.en: Moses was faithful as a servant in all God's house, bearing witness to what would be spoken by God in the future.

verses.zh: 但基督为儿子，治理神的家；我们若将可夸的盼望和胆量坚持到底，便是他的家了。
verses.en: But Christ is faithful as the Son over God's house. And we are his house, if indeed we hold firmly to our confidence and the hope in which we glory.

verses.zh: 圣灵有话说：'你们今日若听他的话，
verses.en: So, as the Holy Spirit says: 'Today, if you hear his voice,

verses.zh: 就不可硬着心，像在旷野惹他发怒、试探他的时候一样。
verses.en: do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion, during the time of testing in the wilderness,

verses.zh: 在那里，你们的祖宗试我探我，并且观看我的作为有四十年之久。
verses.en: where your ancestors tested and tried me, though for forty years they saw what I did.

verses.zh: 所以，我厌烦那世代的人，说：他们心里常常迷糊，竟不晓得我的作为！
verses.en: That is why I was angry with that generation; I said, 'Their hearts are always going astray, and they have not known my ways.'

verses.zh: 我就在怒中起誓说：他们断不可进入我的安息。'
verses.en: So I declared on oath in my anger, 'They shall never enter my rest.'

verses.zh: 弟兄们，你们要谨慎，免得你们中间或有人存着不信的恶心，把永生神离弃了。
verses.en: See to it, brothers and sisters, that none of you has a sinful, unbelieving heart that turns away from the living God.

verses.zh: 总要趁着还有今日，天天彼此相劝，免得你们中间有人被罪迷惑，心里就刚硬了。
verses.en: But encourage one another daily, as long as it is called 'Today,' so that none of you may be hardened by sin's deceitfulness.

verses.zh: 我们若将起初确实的信心坚持到底，就在基督里有分了。
verses.en: We have come to share in Christ, if indeed we hold our original conviction firmly to the very end.

verses.zh: 经上说：'你们今日若听他的话，就不可硬着心，像惹他发怒的日子一样。'
verses.en: As has just been said: 'Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts as you did in the rebellion.'

verses.zh: 那时，听见他话惹他发怒的是谁呢？岂不是跟着摩西从埃及出来的众人吗？
verses.en: Who were they who heard and rebelled? Were they not all those Moses led out of Egypt?

verses.zh: 神四十年之久，又厌烦谁呢？岂不是那些犯罪、尸首倒在旷野的人吗？
verses.en: And with whom was he angry for forty years? Was it not with those who sinned, whose bodies perished in the wilderness?

verses.zh: 又向谁起誓，不容他们进入他的安息呢？岂不是向那些不顺从的人吗？
verses.en: And to whom did God swear that they would never enter his rest if not to those who disobeyed?

verses.zh: 这样看来，他们不能进入安息是因为不信的缘故了。
verses.en: So we see that they were not able to enter, because of their unbelief.

verses.zh: 我们既蒙留下，有进入他安息的应许，就当畏惧，免得我们（原文是你们）中间或有人似乎是赶不上了。
verses.en: Therefore, since the promise of entering his rest still stands, let us be careful that none of you be found to have fallen short of it.

verses.zh: 因为有福音传给我们，像传给他们一样；只是所听见的道与他们无益，因为他们没有信心与所听见的道调和。
verses.en: For we also have had the good news proclaimed to us, just as they did; but the message they heard was of no value to them, because they did not share the faith of those who obeyed.

verses.zh: 但我们已经相信的人得以进入那安息，正如神所说：'我在怒中起誓说：他们断不可进入我的安息！'其实造物之工，从创世以来已经成全了。
verses.en: Now we who have believed enter that rest, just as God has said, 'So I declared on oath in my anger, 'They shall never enter my rest.' And yet his works have been finished since the creation of the world.

verses.zh: 论到第七日，有一处说：'到第七日，神就歇了他一切的工。'
verses.en: For somewhere he has spoken about the seventh day in these words: 'On the seventh day God rested from all his works.'

verses.zh: 又有一处说：'他们断不可进入我的安息！'
verses.en: And again in the passage above he says, 'They shall never enter my rest.'

verses.zh: 既有必进安息的人，那先前听见福音的，因为不顺从，不得进去。
verses.en: Therefore since it still remains for some to enter that rest, and since those who formerly had the good news proclaimed to them did not go in because of their disobedience,

verses.zh: 所以过了多年，就在大卫的书上，又限定一日，如以上所引的说：'你们今日若听他的话，就不可硬着心。'
verses.en: God again set a certain day, calling it 'Today.' This he did when a long time later he spoke through David, as in the passage already quoted: 'Today, if you hear his voice, do not harden your hearts.'

verses.zh: 若是约书亚已叫他们享了安息，后来神就不再提别的日子了。
verses.en: For if Joshua had given them rest, God would not have spoken later about another day.

verses.zh: 这样看来，必另有一安息日的安息为神的子民存留。
verses.en: There remains, then, a Sabbath-rest for the people of God;

verses.zh: 因为那进入安息的，乃是歇了自己的工，正如神歇了他的工一样。
verses.en: for anyone who enters God's rest also rests from their works, just as God did from his.

verses.zh: 所以，我们务必竭力进入那安息，免得有人学那不顺从的样子跌倒了。
verses.en: Let us, therefore, make every effort to enter that rest, so that no one will perish by following their example of disobedience.

verses.zh: 神的道是活泼的，是有功效的，比一切两刃的剑更快，甚至魂与灵，骨节与骨髓，都能刺入、剖开，连心中的思念和主意都能辨明。
verses.en: For the word of God is alive and active. Sharper than any double-edged sword, it penetrates even to dividing soul and spirit, joints and marrow; it judges the thoughts and attitudes of the heart.

verses.zh: 并且被造的没有一样在他面前不显然的；原来万物在那与我们有关系的主眼前，都是赤露敞开的。
verses.en: Nothing in all creation is hidden from God's sight. Everything is uncovered and laid bare before the eyes of him to whom we must give account.

verses.zh: 我们既然有一位已经升入高天尊荣的大祭司，就是神的儿子耶稣，便当持定所承认的道。
verses.en: Therefore, since we have a great high priest who has ascended into heaven, Jesus the Son of God, let us hold firmly to the faith we profess.

verses.zh: 因我们的大祭司并非不能体恤我们的软弱。他也曾凡事受过试探，与我们一样，只是他没有犯罪。
verses.en: For we do not have a high priest who is unable to empathize with our weaknesses, but we have one who has been tempted in every way, just as we are—yet he did not sin.

verses.zh: 所以，我们只管坦然无惧的来到施恩的宝座前，为要得怜恤，蒙恩惠，作随时的帮助。
verses.en: Let us then approach God's throne of grace with confidence, so that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our time of need.

verses.zh: 凡从人间挑选的大祭司，是奉派替人办理属神的事，为要献上礼物和赎罪祭（或译：赎罪的祭）。
verses.en: Every high priest is selected from among the people and is appointed to represent the people in matters related to God, to offer gifts and sacrifices for sins.

verses.zh: 他能体谅那愚蒙的和失迷的人，因为他自己也是被软弱所困。
verses.en: He is able to deal gently with those who are ignorant and are going astray, since he himself is subject to weakness.

verses.zh: 故此，他理当为百姓和自己献祭赎罪。
verses.en: This is why he has to offer sacrifices for his own sins, as well as for the sins of the people.

verses.zh: 这大祭司的尊荣，没有人自取。惟要蒙神所召，像亚伦一样。
verses.en: And no one takes this honor on himself, but he receives it when called by God, just as Aaron was.

verses.zh: 如此，基督也不是自取荣耀作大祭司，乃是在乎向他说'你是我的儿子，我今日生你'的那一位；
verses.en: In the same way, Christ did not take on himself the glory of becoming a high priest. But God said to him, 'You are my Son; today I have become your Father.'

verses.zh: 就如经上又有一处说：'你是照着麦基洗德的等次永远为祭司。'
verses.en: And he says in another place, 'You are a priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.'

verses.zh: 基督在肉体的时候，既大声哀哭，流泪祷告，恳求那能救他免死的主，就因他的虔诚蒙了应允。
verses.en: During the days of Jesus' life on earth, he offered up prayers and petitions with fervent cries and tears to the one who could save him from death, and he was heard because of his reverent submission.

verses.zh: 他虽然为儿子，还是因所受的苦难学了顺从。
verses.en: Son though he was, he learned obedience from what he suffered

verses.zh: 他既得以完全，就为凡顺从他的人成了永远得救的根源，
verses.en: and, once made perfect, he became the source of eternal salvation for all who obey him

verses.zh: 并蒙神照着麦基洗德的等次称他为大祭司。
verses.en: and was designated by God to be high priest in the order of Melchizedek.

verses.zh: 论到麦基洗德，我们有好些话，并且难以解明，因为你们听不进去。
verses.en: We have much to say about this, but it is hard to make it clear to you because you no longer try to understand.

verses.zh: 看你们学习的工夫，本该作师傅，谁知还得有人将神圣言小学的开端另教导你们，并且成了那必须吃奶，不能吃干粮的人。
verses.en: In fact, though by this time you ought to be teachers, you need someone to teach you the elementary truths of God's word all over again. You need milk, not solid food!

verses.zh: 凡只能吃奶的都不熟练仁义的道理，因为他是婴孩；
verses.en: Anyone who lives on milk, being still an infant, is not acquainted with the teaching about righteousness.

verses.zh: 惟独长大成人的才能吃干粮；他们的心窍习练得通达，就能分辨好歹了。
verses.en: But solid food is for the mature, who by constant use have trained themselves to distinguish good from evil.

verses.zh: 所以，我们应当离开基督道理的开端，竭力进到完全的地步，不必再立根基，就如那懊悔死行、信靠神、
verses.en: Therefore let us move beyond the elementary teachings about Christ and be taken forward to maturity, not laying again the foundation of repentance from acts that lead to death, and of faith in God,

verses.zh: 各样洗礼、按手之礼、死人复活，以及永远审判各等教训。
verses.en: instruction about baptisms, the laying on of hands, the resurrection of the dead, and eternal judgment.

verses.zh: 神若许我们，我们必如此行。
verses.en: And God permitting, we will do so.

verses.zh: 论到那些已经蒙了光照、尝过天恩的滋味、又于圣灵有分，
verses.en: It is impossible for those who have once been enlightened, who have tasted the heavenly gift, who have shared in the Holy Spirit,

verses.zh: 并尝过神善道的滋味、觉悟来世权能的人，
verses.en: who have tasted the goodness of the word of God and the powers of the coming age

verses.zh: 若是离弃道理，就不能叫他们从新懊悔了。因为他们把神的儿子重钉十字架，明明的羞辱他。
verses.en: and who have fallen away, to be brought back to repentance. To their loss they are crucifying the Son of God all over again and subjecting him to public disgrace.

verses.zh: 就如一块田地，吃过屡次下的雨水，生长菜蔬，合乎耕种的人用，就从神得福；
verses.en: Land that drinks in the rain often falling on it and that produces a crop useful to those for whom it is farmed receives the blessing of God.

verses.zh: 若长荆棘和蒺藜，必被废弃，近于咒诅，结局就是焚烧。
verses.en: But land that produces thorns and thistles is worthless and is in danger of being cursed. In the end it will be burned.

verses.zh: 亲爱的弟兄们，我们虽是这样说，却深信你们的行为强过这些，而且近乎得救。
verses.en: Even though we speak like this, dear friends, we are convinced of better things in your case—the things that have to do with salvation.

verses.zh: 因为神并非不公义，竟忘记你们所做的工和你们为他名所显的爱心，就是先前伺候圣徒，如今还是伺候。
verses.en: God is not unjust; he will not forget your work and the love you have shown him as you have helped his people and continue to help them.

verses.zh: 我们愿你们各人都显出这样的殷勤，使你们有满足的指望，一直到底。
verses.en: We want each of you to show this same diligence to the very end, so that what you hope for may be fully realized.

verses.zh: 并且不懈怠，总要效法那些凭信心和忍耐承受应许的人。
verses.en: We do not want you to become lazy, but to imitate those who through faith and patience inherit what has been promised.

verses.zh: 当初神应许亚伯拉罕的时候，因为没有比自己更大可以指着起誓的，就指着自己起誓，说：
verses.en: When God made his promise to Abraham, since there was no one greater for him to swear by, he swore by himself,

verses.zh: '论福，我必赐大福给你；论子孙，我必叫你的子孙多起来。'
verses.en: saying, 'I will surely bless you and give you many descendants.'

verses.zh: 这样，亚伯拉罕既恒久忍耐，就得了所应许的。
verses.en: And so after waiting patiently, Abraham received what was promised.

verses.zh: 人都是指着比自己大的起誓，并且以起誓为实据，了结各样的争论。
verses.en: People swear by someone greater than themselves, and the oath confirms what is said and puts an end to all argument.

verses.zh: 照样，神愿意为那承受应许的人格外显明他的旨意是不更改的，就起誓为证。
verses.en: Because God wanted to make the unchanging nature of his purpose very clear to the heirs of what was promised, he confirmed it with an oath.

verses.zh: 藉这两件不更改的事，神决不能说谎，好叫我们这逃往避难所、持定摆在我们前头指望的人可以大得勉励。
verses.en: God did this so that, by two unchangeable things in which it is impossible for God to lie, we who have fled to take hold of the hope set before us may be greatly encouraged.

verses.zh: 我们有这指望，如同灵魂的锚，又坚固又牢靠，且通入幔内。
verses.en: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. It enters the inner sanctuary behind the curtain,

verses.zh: 作先锋的耶稣，既照着麦基洗德的等次成了永远的大祭司，就为我们进入幔内。
verses.en: where our forerunner, Jesus, has entered on our behalf. He has become a high priest forever, in the order of Melchizedek.

verses.zh: 这麦基洗德就是撒冷王，又是至高神的祭司，本是长远活着的。他当亚伯拉罕杀败诸王回来的时候，就迎接他，给他祝福。
verses.en: This Melchizedek was king of Salem and priest of God Most High. He met Abraham returning from the defeat of the kings and blessed him,

verses.zh: 亚伯拉罕也将自己所得来的，取十分之一给他。他头一个名翻出来就是仁义王，他又名撒冷王，就是平安王的意思。
verses.en: and Abraham gave him a tenth of everything. First, the name Melchizedek means 'king of righteousness'; then also, 'king of Salem' means 'king of peace.'

verses.zh: 他无父，无母，无族谱，无生之始，无命之终，乃是与神的儿子相似。
verses.en: Without father or mother, without genealogy, without beginning of days or end of life, resembling the Son of God, he remains a priest forever.

verses.zh: 从前百姓在利未人祭司职任以下受律法，倘若藉这职任能得完全，又何用另外兴起一位祭司，照麦基洗德的等次，不照亚伦的等次呢？
verses.en: If perfection could have been attained through the Levitical priesthood—and indeed the law given to the people established that priesthood—why was there still need for another priest to come, one in the order of Melchizedek, not in the order of Aaron?

verses.zh: 这位既是永远常存的，他祭司的职任就长久不更换。
verses.en: but because Jesus lives forever, he has a permanent priesthood.

verses.zh: 凡靠着他进到神面前的人，他都能拯救到底；因为他是长远活着，替他们祈求。
verses.en: Therefore he is able to save completely those who come to God through him, because he always lives to intercede for them.

verses.zh: 像这样圣洁、无邪恶、无玷污、远离罪人、高过诸天的大祭司，原是与我们合宜的。
verses.en: Such a high priest truly meets our need—one who is holy, blameless, pure, set apart from sinners, exalted above the heavens.

verses.zh: 他不像那些大祭司，每日必须先为自己的罪，后为百姓的罪献祭；因为他只一次将自己献上，就把这事成全了。
verses.en: Unlike the other high priests, he does not need to offer sacrifices day after day, first for his own sins, and then for the sins of the people. He sacrificed for their sins once for all when he offered himself.

verses.zh: 我们所讲的事，其中第一要紧的，就是我们有这样的大祭司，已经坐在天上至大者宝座的右边，
verses.en: Now the main point of what we are saying is this: We do have such a high priest, who sat down at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in heaven,

verses.zh: 在圣所，就是真帐幕里，作执事；这帐幕是主所支的，不是人所支的。
verses.en: and who serves in the sanctuary, the true tabernacle set up by the Lord, not by a mere human being.

verses.zh: 如今耶稣所得的职任是更美的，正如他作更美之约的中保；这约原是凭更美之应许立的。
verses.en: But in fact the ministry Jesus has received is as superior to theirs as the covenant of which he is mediator is superior to the old one, since the new covenant is established on better promises.

verses.zh: 主又说：'那些日子以后，我与以色列家所立的约乃是这样：我要将我的律法放在他们里面，写在他们心上；我要作他们的神；他们要作我的子民。
verses.en: This is the covenant I will establish with the people of Israel after that time, declares the Lord. I will put my laws in their minds and write them on their hearts. I will be their God, and they will be my people.

verses.zh: 我要宽恕他们的不义，不再记念他们的罪愆。'
verses.en: For I will forgive their wickedness and will remember their sins no more.'

verses.zh: 但现在基督已经来到，作了将来美事的大祭司，经过那更大更全备的帐幕，不是人手所造、也不是属乎这世界的；
verses.en: But when Christ came as high priest of the good things that are now already here, he went through the greater and more perfect tabernacle that is not made with human hands, that is to say, is not a part of this creation.

verses.zh: 并且不用山羊和牛犊的血，乃用自己的血，只一次进入圣所，成了永远赎罪的事。
verses.en: He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves; but he entered the Most Holy Place once for all by his own blood, thus obtaining eternal redemption.

verses.zh: 何况基督藉着永远的灵，将自己无瑕无疵献给神，他的血岂不更能洗净你们的心（原文是良心），除去你们的死行，使你们事奉那永生神吗？
verses.en: How much more, then, will the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself unblemished to God, cleanse our consciences from acts that lead to death, so that we may serve the living God!

verses.zh: 按着律法，凡物差不多都是用血洁净的；若不流血，罪就不得赦免了。
verses.en: In fact, the law requires that nearly everything be cleansed with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.

verses.zh: 因为基督并不是进了人手所造的圣所（这不过是真圣所的影像），乃是进了天堂，如今为我们显在神面前；
verses.en: For Christ did not enter a sanctuary made with human hands that was only a copy of the true one; he entered heaven itself, now to appear for us in God's presence.

verses.zh: 如果这样，他从创世以来，就必多次受苦了。但如今在这末世显现一次，把自己献为祭，好除掉罪。
verses.en: Otherwise Christ would have had to suffer many times since the creation of the world. But he has appeared once for all at the culmination of the ages to do away with sin by the sacrifice of himself.

verses.zh: 按着定命，人人都有一死，死后且有审判。
verses.en: Just as people are destined to die once, and after that to face judgment,

verses.zh: 像这样，基督既然一次被献，担当了多人的罪，将来要向那等候他的人第二次显现，并与罪无关，乃是为拯救他们。
verses.en: so Christ was sacrificed once to take away the sins of many; and he will appear a second time, not to bear sin, but to bring salvation to those who are waiting for him.

verses.zh: 律法既是将来美事的影儿，不是本物的真像，总不能藉着每年常献一样的祭物叫那近前来的人得以完全。
verses.en: The law is only a shadow of the good things that are coming—not the realities themselves. For this reason it can never, by the same sacrifices repeated endlessly year after year, make perfect those who draw near to worship.

verses.zh: 因为公牛和山羊的血，断不能除罪。
verses.en: It is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.

verses.zh: 我们凭这旨意，靠耶稣基督，只一次献上他的身体，就得以成圣。
verses.en: And by that will, we have been made holy through the sacrifice of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我们既因耶稣的血得以坦然进入至圣所，
verses.en: Therefore, brothers and sisters, since we have confidence to enter the Most Holy Place by the blood of Jesus,

verses.zh: 是藉着他给我们开了一条又新又活的路，从幔子经过，这幔子就是他的身体。
verses.en: by a new and living way opened for us through the curtain, that is, his body,

verses.zh: 并我们心中天良的亏欠已经洒去，身体用清水洗净了，就当存着诚心和充足的信心来到神面前；
verses.en: let us draw near to God with a sincere heart and with the full assurance that faith brings, having our hearts sprinkled to cleanse us from a guilty conscience and having our bodies washed with pure water.

verses.zh: 也要坚守我们所承认的指望，不至摇动，因为那应许我们的是信实的。
verses.en: Let us hold unswervingly to the hope we profess, for he who promised is faithful.

verses.zh: 又要彼此相顾，激发爱心，勉励行善。
verses.en: And let us consider how we may spur one another on toward love and good deeds,

verses.zh: 你们不可停止聚会，好像那些停止惯了的人，倒要彼此劝勉，既知道（原文是看见）那日子临近，就更当如此。
verses.en: not giving up meeting together, as some are in the habit of doing, but encouraging one another—and all the more as you see the Day approaching.

verses.zh: 只是义人（有古卷：我的义人）必因信得生。他若退后，我心里就不喜欢他。
verses.en: And, 'But my righteous one will live by faith. And I take no pleasure in the one who shrinks back.'

verses.zh: 我们却不是退后入沉沦的那等人，乃是有信心以致灵魂得救的人。
verses.en: But we do not belong to those who shrink back and are destroyed, but to those who have faith and are saved.

verses.zh: 信就是所望之事的实底，是未见之事的确据。
verses.en: Now faith is confidence in what we hope for and assurance about what we do not see.

verses.zh: 古人在这信上得了美好的证据。
verses.en: This is what the ancients were commended for.

verses.zh: 我们因着信，就知道诸世界是藉神话造成的；这样，所看见的，并不是从显然之物造出来的。
verses.en: By faith we understand that the universe was formed at God's command, so that what is seen was not made out of what was visible.

verses.zh: 亚伯因着信，献祭与神，比该隐所献的更美，因此便得了称义的见证，就是神指他礼物作的见证。他虽然死了，却因这信，仍旧说话。
verses.en: By faith Abel brought God a better offering than Cain did. By faith he was commended as righteous, when God spoke well of his offerings. And by faith Abel still speaks, even though he is dead.

verses.zh: 以诺因着信，被接去，不至于见死，人也找不着他，因为神已经把他接去了；只是他被接去以先，已经得了神喜悦他的明证。
verses.en: By faith Enoch was taken from this life, so that he did not experience death: 'He could not be found, because God had taken him away.' For before he was taken, he was commended as one who pleased God.

verses.zh: 人非有信，就不能得神的喜悦；因为到神面前来的人必须信有神，且信他赏赐那寻求他的人。
verses.en: And without faith it is impossible to please God, because anyone who comes to him must believe that he exists and that he rewards those who earnestly seek him.

verses.zh: 挪亚因着信，既蒙神指示他未见的事，动了敬畏的心，预备了一只方舟，使他全家得救。因此就定了那世代的罪，自己也承受了那从信而来的义。
verses.en: By faith Noah, when warned about things not yet seen, in holy fear built an ark to save his family. By his faith he condemned the world and became heir of the righteousness that is in keeping with faith.

verses.zh: 亚伯拉罕因着信，蒙召的时候就遵命出去，往将来要得为业的地方去；出去的时候，还不知往哪里去。
verses.en: By faith Abraham, when called to go to a place he would later receive as his inheritance, obeyed and went, even though he did not know where he was going.

verses.zh: 他因着信，就在所应许之地作客，好像在异地居住帐棚，与那同蒙一个应许的以撒、雅各一样。
verses.en: By faith he made his home in the promised land like a stranger in a foreign country; he lived in tents, as did Isaac and Jacob, who were heirs with him of the same promise.

verses.zh: 因为他等候那座有根基的城，就是神所经营所建造的。
verses.en: For he was looking forward to the city with foundations, whose architect and builder is God.

verses.zh: 因着信，连撒拉自己，虽然过了生育的岁数，还能怀孕，因她以为那应许她的是可信的。
verses.en: And by faith even Sarah, who was past childbearing age, was enabled to bear children because she considered him faithful who had made the promise.

verses.zh: 这些人都是存着信心死的，并没有得着所应许的；却从远处望见，且欢喜迎接，又承认自己在世上是客旅，是寄居的。
verses.en: All these people were still living by faith when they died. They did not receive the things promised; they only saw them and welcomed them from a distance, admitting that they were foreigners and strangers on earth.

verses.zh: 他们却羡慕一个更美的家乡，就是在天上的。所以神被称为他们的神，并不以为耻，因为他已经给他们预备了一座城。
verses.en: Instead, they were longing for a better country—a heavenly one. Therefore God is not ashamed to be called their God, for he has prepared a city for them.

verses.zh: 亚伯拉罕因着信，被试验的时候，就把以撒献上；这便是那欢喜领受应许的，将自己独生的儿子献上。
verses.en: By faith Abraham, when God tested him, offered Isaac as a sacrifice. He who had embraced the promises was about to sacrifice his one and only son,

verses.zh: 摩西生下来，他的父母见他是个俊美的孩子，就因着信，把他藏了三个月，并不怕王命。
verses.en: By faith Moses' parents hid him for three months after he was born, because they saw he was no ordinary child, and they were not afraid of the king's edict.

verses.zh: 摩西因着信，长大了就不肯称为法老女儿之子。
verses.en: By faith Moses, when he had grown up, refused to be known as the son of Pharaoh's daughter.

verses.zh: 他宁可和神的百姓同受苦害，也不愿暂时享受罪中之乐。
verses.en: He chose to be mistreated along with the people of God rather than to enjoy the fleeting pleasures of sin.

verses.zh: 他看为基督受的凌辱比埃及的财物更宝贵，因他想望所要得的赏赐。
verses.en: He regarded disgrace for the sake of Christ as of greater value than the treasures of Egypt, because he was looking ahead to his reward.

verses.zh: 以色列人因着信，围绕耶利哥城七日，城墙就倒塌了。
verses.en: By faith the walls of Jericho fell, after the army had marched around them for seven days.

verses.zh: 妓女喇合因着信，曾和和平平的接待探子，就不与那些不顺从的人一同灭亡。
verses.en: By faith the prostitute Rahab, because she welcomed the spies, was not killed with those who were disobedient.

verses.zh: 我又何必再说呢？若要一一细说，基甸、巴拉、参孙、耶弗他、大卫、撒母耳，和众先知的事，时候就不够了。
verses.en: And what more shall I say? I do not have time to tell about Gideon, Barak, Samson and Jephthah, about David and Samuel and the prophets,

verses.zh: 他们因着信，制伏了敌国，行了公义，得了应许，堵了狮子的口，
verses.en: who through faith conquered kingdoms, administered justice, and gained what was promised; who shut the mouths of lions,

verses.zh: 灭了烈火的猛势，脱了刀剑的锋刃；软弱变为刚强，争战显出勇敢，打退外邦的全军。
verses.en: quenched the fury of the flames, and escaped the edge of the sword; whose weakness was turned to strength; and who became powerful in battle and routed foreign armies.

verses.zh: 有妇人得自己的死人复活。又有人忍受严刑，不肯苟且得释放（原文是赎），为要得着更美的复活。
verses.en: Women received back their dead, raised to life again. There were others who were tortured, refusing to be released so that they might gain an even better resurrection.

verses.zh: 又有人忍受戏弄、鞭打、捆锁、监禁、各等的磨炼，
verses.en: Some faced jeers and flogging, and even chains and imprisonment.

verses.zh: 被石头打死，被锯锯死，受试探，被刀杀，披着绵羊山羊的皮各处奔跑，受穷乏、患难、苦害，
verses.en: They were put to death by stoning; they were sawed in two; they were killed by the sword. They went about in sheepskins and goatskins, destitute, persecuted and mistreated—

verses.zh: 在旷野、山岭、山洞、地穴，飘流无定，本是世界不配有的人。
verses.en: the world was not worthy of them. They wandered in deserts and mountains, living in caves and in holes in the ground.

verses.zh: 这些人都是因信得了美好的证据，却仍未得着所应许的；
verses.en: These were all commended for their faith, yet none of them received what had been promised,

verses.zh: 因为神给我们预备了更美的事，叫他们若不与我们同得，就不能完全。
verses.en: since God had planned something better for us so that only together with us would they be made perfect.

verses.zh: 我们既有这许多的见证人，如同云彩围着我们，就当放下各样的重担，脱去容易缠累我们的罪，存心忍耐，奔那摆在我们前头的路程，
verses.en: Therefore, since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses, let us throw off everything that hinders and the sin that so easily entangles. And let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us,

verses.zh: 仰望为我们信心创始成终的耶稣（或译：仰望那将真道创始成终的耶稣）。他因那摆在前面的喜乐，就轻看羞辱，忍受了十字架的苦难，便坐在神宝座的右边。
verses.en: fixing our eyes on Jesus, the pioneer and perfecter of faith. For the joy set before him he endured the cross, scorning its shame, and sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.

verses.zh: 那忍受罪人这样顶撞的，你们要思想，免得疲倦灰心。
verses.en: Consider him who endured such opposition from sinners, so that you will not grow weary and lose heart.

verses.zh: 你们与罪恶相争，还没有抵挡到流血的地步。
verses.en: In your struggle against sin, you have not yet resisted to the point of shedding your blood.

verses.zh: 你们又忘了那劝你们如同劝儿子的话，说：'我儿，你不可轻看主的管教，被他责备的时候也不可灰心；
verses.en: And have you completely forgotten this word of encouragement that addresses you as a father addresses his son? It says, 'My son, do not make light of the Lord's discipline, and do not lose heart when he rebukes you,

verses.zh: 因为主所爱的，他必管教，又鞭打凡所收纳的儿子。'
verses.en: because the Lord disciplines the one he loves, and he chastens everyone he accepts as his son.'

verses.zh: 你们所忍受的，是神管教你们，待你们如同待儿子。焉有儿子不被父亲管教的呢？
verses.en: Endure hardship as discipline; God is treating you as his children. For what children are not disciplined by their father?

verses.zh: 管教原是众子所共受的，你们若不受管教，就是私子，不是儿子了。
verses.en: If you are not disciplined—and everyone undergoes discipline—then you are not legitimate, not true sons and daughters at all.

verses.zh: 生身的父都是暂随己意管教我们；惟有万灵的父管教我们，是要我们得益处，使我们在他的圣洁上有分。
verses.en: They disciplined us for a little while as they thought best; but God disciplines us for our good, in order that we may share in his holiness.

verses.zh: 凡管教的事，当时不觉得快乐，反觉得愁苦；后来却为那经练过的人结出平安的果子，就是义。
verses.en: No discipline seems pleasant at the time, but painful. Later on, however, it produces a harvest of righteousness and peace for those who have been trained by it.

verses.zh: 所以，你们要把下垂的手、发酸的腿挺起来；
verses.en: Therefore, strengthen your feeble arms and weak knees.

verses.zh: 也要为自己的脚，把道路修直了，使瘸子不至歪脚（或译：差路），反得痊愈。
verses.en: Make level paths for your feet, so that the lame may not be disabled, but rather healed.

verses.zh: 你们要追求与众人和睦，并要追求圣洁；非圣洁没有人能见主。
verses.en: Make every effort to live in peace with everyone and to be holy; without holiness no one will see the Lord.

verses.zh: 又要谨慎，恐怕有人失了神的恩；恐怕有毒根生出来扰乱你们，因此叫众人沾染污秽；
verses.en: See to it that no one falls short of the grace of God and that no bitter root grows up to cause trouble and defile many.

verses.zh: 你们乃是来到锡安山，永生神的城邑，就是天上的耶路撒冷。那里有千万的天使，
verses.en: But you have come to Mount Zion, to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem. You have come to thousands upon thousands of angels in joyful assembly,

verses.zh: 有名录在天上诸长子之会所共聚的总会，有审判众人的神和被成全之义人的灵魂，
verses.en: to the church of the firstborn, whose names are written in heaven. You have come to God, the Judge of all, to the spirits of the righteous made perfect,

verses.zh: 并新约的中保耶稣，以及所洒的血；这血所说的比亚伯的血所说的更美。
verses.en: to Jesus the mediator of a new covenant, and to the sprinkled blood that speaks a better word than the blood of Abel.

verses.zh: 所以我们既得了不能震动的国，就当感恩，照神所喜悦的，用虔诚、敬畏的心事奉神。
verses.en: Therefore, since we are receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us be thankful, and so worship God acceptably with reverence and awe,

verses.zh: 因为我们的神乃是烈火。
verses.en: for our 'God is a consuming fire.'

verses.zh: 你们务要常存弟兄相爱的心。
verses.en: Keep on loving one another as brothers and sisters.

verses.zh: 不可忘记用爱心接待客旅；因为曾有接待客旅的，不知不觉就接待了天使。
verses.en: Do not forget to show hospitality to strangers, for by so doing some people have shown hospitality to angels without knowing it.

verses.zh: 你们要记念被捆绑的人，好像与他们同受捆绑；也要记念遭苦害的人，想到自己也在肉身之内。
verses.en: Continue to remember those in prison as if you were together with them in prison, and those who are mistreated as if you yourselves were suffering.

verses.zh: 婚姻，人人都当尊重，床也不可污秽；因为苟合行淫的人，神必要审判。
verses.en: Marriage should be honored by all, and the marriage bed kept pure, for God will judge the adulterer and all the sexually immoral.

verses.zh: 你们存心不可贪爱钱财，要以自己所有的为足；因为主曾说：'我总不撇下你，也不丢弃你。'
verses.en: Keep your lives free from the love of money and be content with what you have, because God has said, 'Never will I leave you; never will I forsake you.'

verses.zh: 所以我们可以放胆说：'主是帮助我的，我必不惧怕；人能把我怎么样呢？'
verses.en: So we say with confidence, 'The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid. What can mere mortals do to me?'

verses.zh: 从前引导你们、传神之道给你们的人，你们要想念他们，效法他们的信心，留心看他们为人的结局。
verses.en: Remember your leaders, who spoke the word of God to you. Consider the outcome of their way of life and imitate their faith.

verses.zh: 耶稣基督，昨日、今日、一直到永远，是一样的。
verses.en: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and today and forever.

verses.zh: 你们不要被那诸般怪异的教训勾引了去；因为人心靠恩得坚固才是好的，并不是靠饮食。那在饮食上专心的从来没有得着益处。
verses.en: Do not be carried away by all kinds of strange teachings. It is good for our hearts to be strengthened by grace, not by eating ceremonial foods, which is of no benefit to those who do so.

verses.zh: 我们有一祭坛，上面的祭物是那些在帐幕中供职的人不可同吃的。
verses.en: We have an altar from which those who minister at the tabernacle have no right to eat.

verses.zh: 原来牲畜的血被大祭司带入圣所作赎罪祭；牲畜的身子被烧在营外。
verses.en: The high priest carries the blood of animals into the Most Holy Place as a sin offering, but the bodies are burned outside the camp.

verses.zh: 所以，耶稣要用自己的血叫百姓成圣，也就在城门外受苦。
verses.en: And so Jesus also suffered outside the city gate to make the people holy through his own blood.

verses.zh: 这样，我们也当出到营外，就了他去，忍受他所受的凌辱。
verses.en: Let us, then, go to him outside the camp, bearing the disgrace he bore.

verses.zh: 我们在这里本没有常存的城，乃是寻求那将来的城。
verses.en: For here we do not have an enduring city, but we are looking for the city that is to come.

verses.zh: 我们应当靠着耶稣，常常以颂赞为祭献给神，这就是那承认主名之人嘴唇的果子。
verses.en: Through Jesus, therefore, let us continually offer to God a sacrifice of praise—the fruit of lips that openly profess his name.

verses.zh: 只是不可忘记行善和捐输的事；因为这样的祭，是神所喜悦的。
verses.en: And do not forget to do good and to share with others, for with such sacrifices God is pleased.

verses.zh: 你们要依从那些引导你们的，且要顺服；因他们为你们的灵魂时刻警醒，好像那将来交账的人。你们要使他们交的时候有快乐，不至忧愁；若忧愁就与你们无益了。
verses.en: Have confidence in your leaders and submit to their authority, because they keep watch over you as those who must give an account. Do this so that their work will be a joy, not a burden, for that would be of no benefit to you.

verses.zh: 请你们为我们祷告，因我们自觉良心无亏，愿意凡事按正道而行。
verses.en: Pray for us. We are sure that we have a clear conscience and desire to live honorably in every way.

verses.zh: 我更求你们为我祷告，使我快些回到你们那里去。
verses.en: I particularly urge you to pray so that I may be restored to you soon.

verses.zh: 但愿赐平安的神，就是那凭永约之血、使群羊的大牧人我主耶稣从死里复活的神，
verses.en: Now may the God of peace, who through the blood of the eternal covenant brought back from the dead our Lord Jesus, that great Shepherd of the sheep,

verses.zh: 在各样善事上成全你们，叫你们遵行他的旨意；又借着耶稣基督在你们心里行他所喜悦的事。愿荣耀归给他，直到永永远远。阿们！
verses.en: equip you with everything good for doing his will, and may he work in us what is pleasing to him, through Jesus Christ, to whom be glory for ever and ever. Amen.

verses.zh: 弟兄们，我略略写信给你们，望你们听我劝勉的话。
verses.en: Brothers and sisters, I urge you to bear with my word of exhortation, for in fact I have written to you quite briefly.

verses.zh: 你们该知道，我们的兄弟提摩太已经释放了；他若快来，我必同他去见你们。
verses.en: I want you to know that our brother Timothy has been released. If he arrives soon, I will come with him to see you.

verses.zh: 请你们问引导你们的诸位和众圣徒安。从意大利来的人也问你们安。
verses.en: Greet all your leaders and all the Lord's people. Those from Italy send you their greetings.

verses.zh: 愿恩惠常与你们众人同在。阿们！
verses.en: Grace be with you all.
